questions.question: The theme of a story is its _________.
You can always tell what the theme of a story is by ____________.

choices.answer: reading carefully to find where an author directly states it
putting the main ideas together in a single sentence
researching where and when the author lived

questions.question: Which of the following might be the theme of a story?

choices.answer: A brave young girl pretends to be a man.
Some people are afraid of heights.
"I'll get you, my pretty, and your little dog, too."

questions.question: What is the difference between theme and the main idea of a story?

choices.answer: A story only has one main idea but has more than one theme
Author tells you the theme. You use clues to find main idea
Main idea is what astory is about Theme is universal message
There is no difference. They're the same.

questions.question: True or False: Two stories can share the same theme.
Friendship helps people get through hard times. This is an example of a ________.
True or False: A story cannot have more than one theme.
Which of the following would not be considered a theme?

choices.answer: a soldier coming home from World War I

questions.question: Which of the following could be a theme of Goldilocks and the Three Bears?

choices.answer: why you shouldn't eat cold porridge
A curious girl breaks into a stranger's house.

questions.question: Which of the following would be the best way to get the theme of friendship across in a story?

choices.answer: have the characters get to know each other
have the characters overcome a fear
